definition: to be just like/can be compared to
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello
Belgium/Belgian/abbr. for 比利時|比利时[Bi3 li4 shi2]
to compare/(followed by a noun and adjective) more {adj.} than {noun}/ratio/to gesture/(Taiwan pr. [bi4] in some compounds derived from Classical Chinese)

sentences.english: We were sitting birds asking to be knocked off.
sentences.chinese: 我们好比一群马，坐在那儿等人打死。

sentences.english: Hemingway was as handsome as a film star , Bogart as sophisticated as a writer .
sentences.chinese: 海明威英俊好比影星，而鲍嘉睿智有如作家。

sentences.english: It’s like going to the movie theater and having to decide which movie to watch.
sentences.chinese: 就好比去电影院看电影，必须决定看哪一部影片。

sentences.english: It's like shifting gears too quickly in a car.
sentences.chinese: 这好比汽车的排挡切换过快。

sentences.english: This is like building a building with a measuring rod that constantly changes.
sentences.chinese: 这就好比建造一栋建筑，而测量杆却不停的在变动。

sentences.english: The sluggard is like a lump of dung; whoever touches him wipes his hands.
sentences.chinese: 懒惰人好比一堆牛粪，摸着的人，都将它从手中抖掉。

sentences.english: Expeditions are planned in as much detail as a military campaign.
sentences.chinese: 如今的野外考察就好比军事战役一样计划周密。

sentences.english: A light purse is a heavy curse .
sentences.chinese: 小金库好比一个巨大的诅咒。

sentences.english: Free verse is like free love; it is contradiction in terms.
sentences.chinese: 自由诗好比自由恋爱，那是语词矛盾的说话。

sentences.english: I love you as much as a beggar needs a crutch.
sentences.chinese: 我爱你好比乞丐需要拐棍。

sentences.english: Think of it as the connective tissue for HP's cloud.
sentences.chinese: 它就好比惠普云中的结缔组织。

sentences.english: It is reflected in the mind as 'I am', as the ornament's particular name and shape.
sentences.chinese: 它在头脑中反映为本觉，好比金饰的个别名相。

sentences.english: This leads to phenomena like overconfidence.
sentences.chinese: 这就导致了好比过度自信的现象。

sentences.english: It is just like robbing Peter to pay Paul if you try to prepare for the English exam during a maths class.
sentences.chinese: 如果你在数学课上准备英语考试，那好比是挖肉补疮。

sentences.english: Like introducing vicious piranhas into a peaceful lake.
sentences.chinese: 就好比将水虎鱼放进一个平静的湖泊。

sentences.english: This is like having an instruction manual in which all the copies have the same typographical error.
sentences.chinese: 就好比所有说明书出现同样的印刷错误。

definition: Tongli, a city in Jiangsu Province, China
that/those/then (in that case)/commonly pr. [nei4] before a classifier, esp. in Beijing
(emphasizes that sth is precisely or exactly as stated)/precisely/exactly/even/if/just like/in the same way as
as the proverb says/as they say...
